clusters.title: AI Concerns
clusters.description: A 2024 Cisco survey reveals that 48% of businesses have input non-public information into generative AI tools, while 69% fear potential damage to intellectual property and legal rights. Public sentiment is mixed, with 54% of Americans cautious and 22% scared about AI advancements, though 19% are excited. Additionally, 52% of workers believe AI will aid career growth, but 39% express workplace concerns. GDPR and GINA reflect regulatory responses, and Meta has restricted AI use in political campaigns. Awareness of AI's impact is growing, with skills development a priority for many workers.

articles.title: The Future of AI: How Artificial Intelligence Will Change the World

facts.fact_content: 48% of businesses have entered non-public company information into generative AI tools according to a 2024 Cisco survey.
facts.narrative: In 2024, a significant 48% of businesses reported inputting confidential company data into generative AI tools, revealing widespread usage and potential risks associated with these technologies.

article.title: The Future of AI: How Artificial Intelligence Will Change the World

facts.fact_content: 69% of businesses are worried generative AI tools could damage their intellectual property and legal rights according to a 2024 Cisco survey.
facts.narrative: Despite their use, 69% of businesses expressed concern over generative AI tools potentially harming their intellectual property and legal rights, highlighting a key area of apprehension.

article.title: The Future of AI: How Artificial Intelligence Will Change the World

articles.title: Is AI Good or Bad for Society?

facts.fact_content: 54% of Americans said they were cautious about advances in AI.
facts.narrative: Public sentiment on AI is mixed; 54% of Americans approach AI advancements with caution.

article.title: Is AI Good or Bad for Society?

facts.fact_content: 22% of Americans said they were scared about advances in AI.
facts.narrative: Furthermore, 22% of Americans report fear regarding AI's rapid development.

article.title: Is AI Good or Bad for Society?

facts.fact_content: 19% of Americans said they were excited about advances in AI.
facts.narrative: In contrast, 19% express excitement about the potential of AI advancements.

article.title: Is AI Good or Bad for Society?

articles.title: Ethical Issues of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine and Healthcare

facts.fact_content: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) was first enacted by the European Union (EU).
facts.narrative: The European Union's GDPR represents a foundational step in data protection and privacy in relation to AI.

article.title: Ethical Issues of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine and Healthcare

facts.fact_content: The Genetic Information Non-discrimination Acts (GINA) prohibits employers from discriminative decisions according to the genetic health information of individuals.
facts.narrative: Similarly, GINA protects individuals from genetic discrimination, emphasizing the importance of ethical considerations in technology.

article.title: Ethical Issues of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine and Healthcare

articles.title: 7 ways AI could bring more harm than good

facts.fact_content: Meta revised its policies in 2023 to limit the use of generative AI for campaigns connected to elections, politics, and social issues.
facts.narrative: In response to ethical concerns, Meta updated its 2023 policies to restrict generative AI use in sensitive areas like elections and politics.

article.title: 7 ways AI could bring more harm than good

facts.fact_content: In March 2023, a glitch in ChatGPT allowed users to access titles of other users' chat history.
facts.narrative: Security issues are not uncommon, as demonstrated by a March 2023 ChatGPT glitch exposing user chat titles.

article.title: 7 ways AI could bring more harm than good

articles.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 52% of workers believe AI will help their career growth and promotion.
facts.narrative: In the workplace, 52% of employees see AI as a tool for career advancement.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 47% are excited about the prospect of AI in the workplace.
facts.narrative: A nearly equal 47% express enthusiasm for AI's potential to transform the workplace.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 39% are worried about the prospect of AI in the workplace.
facts.narrative: However, 39% of workers remain apprehensive about AI's impact.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: One-third are already using AI tools at work.
facts.narrative: Notably, one-third of the workforce is already integrating AI tools into their daily tasks.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 53% believe their role and industry will eventually be swept up in the AI revolution.
facts.narrative: Looking ahead, 53% predict that AI will transform their roles and industries entirely.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 59% said they have the right skills today to make use of the latest technology.
facts.narrative: Encouragingly, 59% of workers feel equipped with the skills needed for today's technological landscape.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 17% said they do not have the right skills today to make use of the latest technology.
facts.narrative: Yet, 17% acknowledge a skills gap in adapting to new tech.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 22% of workers want learning and development support to use AI.
facts.narrative: A proactive 22% of workers seek further learning and development to harness AI effectively.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 13% reported receiving learning and development support to use AI during the past 12 months.
facts.narrative: However, only 13% have received such training in the past year.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

articles.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

facts.fact_content: The risk of something seriously dangerous happening with AI is in the five-year timeframe, 10 years at most.
facts.narrative: Amidst these developments, experts warn of serious AI risks emerging within five to ten years.

article.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

facts.narrative: In 2024, a significant 48% of businesses reported inputting confidential company data into generative AI tools, revealing widespread usage and potential risks associated with these technologies.

clusters.title: Job Disruption
clusters.description: By 2025, 85 million jobs might be displaced, but 97 million new jobs requiring advanced skills will emerge. Between 2023 and 2028, 44% of workers' skills will face disruption. Automation could impact 30% of working hours in the U.S. by 2030. In the next five years, 23% of jobs may be affected by churn. A significant number of workers, especially those aged 35 to 44, feel the need for learning opportunities to secure their careers. Moreover, 37% of employees, including 47% of Gen Z, are willing to leave their jobs if their skilling expectations aren't met.

articles.title: 5 Ethical Considerations of AI in Business

facts.fact_content: 85 million jobs could be displaced by 2025.
facts.narrative: By 2025, there is a looming threat of 85 million jobs being displaced, signaling a significant shift in the employment landscape.

article.title: 5 Ethical Considerations of AI in Business

facts.fact_content: 97 million new jobs emerging that require advanced technical competencies and soft skills by 2025.
facts.narrative: However, this disruption also brings opportunity, with 97 million new jobs requiring advanced technical skills and soft competencies projected to emerge by 2025.

article.title: 5 Ethical Considerations of AI in Business

articles.title: The Future of AI: How Artificial Intelligence Will Change the World

facts.fact_content: 44% of workers' skills will be disrupted between 2023 and 2028.
facts.narrative: Between 2023 and 2028, 44% of workers' skills are expected to be disrupted, emphasizing the need for reskilling and adaptation to meet future demands.

article.title: The Future of AI: How Artificial Intelligence Will Change the World

articles.title: 7 ways AI could bring more harm than good

facts.fact_content: 30% of the hours currently worked in the U.S. economy have the potential to be automated by 2030.
facts.narrative: Additionally, automation is on the rise, with 30% of current work hours in the U.S. potentially being automated by 2030, further altering the job market.

article.title: 7 ways AI could bring more harm than good

articles.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 23% of jobs will be affected by churn in the next five years.
facts.narrative: In the next five years, job churn will impact 23% of positions, indicating a dynamic job market that requires agility and continuous learning.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 55% say they need learning opportunities to future-proof their careers.
facts.narrative: A majority, 55%, recognize the importance of learning opportunities to secure their future careers.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 60% of those aged 35-44 feel they need learning opportunities to future-proof their careers.
facts.narrative: This sentiment is particularly strong among those aged 35-44, with 60% feeling the need for career future-proofing through learning.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 47% of people aged 55-67 feel they need learning opportunities to future-proof their careers.
facts.narrative: Even among the older workforce, aged 55-67, 47% feel the necessity of learning opportunities for career longevity.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 37% say they will leave their jobs if their expectations for skilling are not met.
facts.narrative: If these expectations for skilling are unmet, 37% of employees indicate they would leave their jobs.

article.title: Is AI a friend or foe? The truth depends on what we do now

facts.fact_content: 47% of Gen Z respondents say they will leave their jobs if their expectations for skilling are not met.
facts.narrative: This is even more pronounced among Gen Z, with 47% ready to leave positions if skilling needs are not fulfilled.

clusters.title: AI Expansion
clusters.description: Investment in AI technologies has quadrupled over the past year, reflecting the exponential growth of AI. Additionally, AI surveillance systems are being expanded in at least 75 countries. Ethical concerns arise with AI applications, such as China's plan to use a social credit system to score its citizens and the potential deployment of autonomous weaponized drones. Historical misuse of data, like Cambridge Analytica's use of Facebook data, highlights the importance of responsible AI deployment.

articles.title: A Real Risk for Artificial Intelligence

facts.fact_content: Investments in AI technologies have quadrupled in the last year.
facts.narrative: The last year has witnessed a significant surge in the AI sector, with investments quadrupling, highlighting the rapid growth and potential of artificial intelligence.

titles.chart_title: AI Investment Growth Over the Last Year

article.title: A Real Risk for Artificial Intelligence

articles.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

facts.fact_content: AI is growing at a pace close to exponential.
facts.narrative: The growth of AI technology is nearing exponential levels, underscoring its transformative impact across various industries.

article.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

facts.fact_content: Cambridge Analytica used the data from 50 million Facebook users.
facts.narrative: The Cambridge Analytica scandal, involving the misuse of data from 50 million Facebook users, remains a stark reminder of the privacy concerns surrounding data and AI.

article.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

facts.fact_content: China's social credit system is expected to give every one of its 1.4 billion citizens a personal score based on behavior.
facts.narrative: China's ambitious social credit system aims to assign personal scores to its 1.4 billion citizens based on behavior, reflecting AI's deep integration into societal governance.

article.title: Is Artificial Intelligence Dangerous? 6 AI Risks Everyone Should Know About

articles.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: At least 75 countries are expanding AI surveillance systems.
facts.narrative: A global trend is emerging as at least 75 countries are expanding their AI surveillance systems, reflecting the increasing reliance on AI for security and monitoring.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: A million tiny drones equipped with explosives, visual recognition capacity, and autonomous navigational ability can be contained within a regular shipping container.
facts.narrative: The potential militarization of AI is evident with the capability to fit a million tiny drones, equipped with explosives and autonomous navigation, into a single shipping container.

clusters.title: Election Subversion
clusters.description: AI-driven subversion was reported in several major elections, including the 2013 and 2017 Kenyan elections, the 2016 US presidential election, and the 2017 French presidential election. This highlights the impact of artificial intelligence on electoral processes.

articles.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2013 and 2017 Kenyan elections.
facts.narrative: The integrity of the Kenyan elections in both 2013 and 2017 faced challenges due to AI-driven subversion, raising concerns about the influence of technology on democratic processes.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2016 US presidential election.
facts.narrative: The 2016 US presidential election also experienced AI-driven subversion, highlighting a global issue where technology is used to impact electoral outcomes.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2017 French presidential election.
facts.narrative: Similarly, the 2017 French presidential election was not immune to AI-driven subversion, indicating a pattern of technological interference in key democratic events worldwide.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2013 and 2017 Kenyan elections.
facts.narrative: The integrity of the Kenyan elections in both 2013 and 2017 faced challenges due to AI-driven subversion, raising concerns about the influence of technology on democratic processes.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2016 US presidential election.
facts.narrative: The 2016 US presidential election also experienced AI-driven subversion, highlighting a global issue where technology is used to impact electoral outcomes.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence

facts.fact_content: AI-driven subversion of elections occurred in the 2017 French presidential election.
facts.narrative: Similarly, the 2017 French presidential election was not immune to AI-driven subversion, indicating a pattern of technological interference in key democratic events worldwide.

article.title: Threats by artificial intelligence to human health and human existence
